question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Logger Backend] Does the aptos_logger backend properly handle high-volume logs without blocking, or can logging cause API latency? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Sample Macro] Can the sample! macro from aptos_logger be exploited to bypass rate limiting or cause unexpected behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Path Disclosure] Does logging the full request path at line 22 expose sensitive API endpoints or internal routing information to attackers monitoring logs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Header Disclosure] Can logged headers contain authentication tokens, API keys, or session identifiers that leak credential information? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [IP Correlation] Can the combination of remote_addr and forwarded headers enable de-anonymization of validator operators or API users? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Log Level] Are debug logs at line 35 enabled in production, potentially exposing sensitive request details for all non-error requests? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Sampling Configuration] Is the SampleRate::Duration(Duration::from_secs(1)) at line 33 configurable, or is it hardcoded allowing no adjustment for different deployment scenarios? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Production Deployment] In production validator deployments, can the debug! calls at line 35 be disabled to prevent information leakage? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Log Flooding] Can an attacker send rapid 499 status requests (client disconnects) to flood debug logs while bypassing the 500+ error sampling, exhausting disk space? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Amplification Attack] Can attackers trigger expensive logging operations by sending requests with maximum-size headers, amplifying resource consumption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Log Correlation Attack] Can timing patterns in elapsed Duration logs be correlated with blockchain transactions to de-anonymize validator operators? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [FORWARDED Chain Attack] Can an attacker inject a long chain of proxies in the FORWARDED header to obscure their true origin while consuming logging resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Lifetime Elision] Are the lifetime annotations at line 42 correctly specified, or can lifetime elision rules cause unexpected borrowing issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Closure Capture] Does the move closure at line 17 capture any variables that could cause unexpected ownership transfers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Type Inference] Can type inference at line 17 lead to unexpected trait implementations that bypass security checks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Header Access] Does info.request_headers() at line 28 provide raw access to all headers, and can this expose sensitive headers beyond FORWARDED? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Header Count] Is there a limit on the number of headers processed, or can an attacker send thousands of headers to slow down logging? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Header Case Sensitivity] Is header::FORWARDED case-sensitive, allowing attackers to bypass logging by using 'forwarded' or 'FORWARDED'? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Status Code Boundary] Are status codes exactly at 500 properly handled, or is there an off-by-one error in the >= 500 check at line 32? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Zero Duration] Can elapsed time be zero or negative, and does this cause any formatting or comparison issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Optional Fields] Do the optional fields (remote_addr, referer, user_agent, forwarded) properly handle None cases without causing panics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Data Retention] Does logging IPs and user agents at lines 20, 25 comply with data retention policies, or can this expose Aptos to regulatory violations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [PII Logging] Are there mechanisms to redact or anonymize PII from logs before storage, or is all data logged in plaintext? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Return Type] Does the custom(func) call at line 38 properly type-check the closure, or can type mismatches cause runtime issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Macro Expansion] Can the sample! macro expansion at line 33 introduce code injection vulnerabilities if macro arguments are improperly sanitized? (Low)
